text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 1143 rows 2 columns. object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 1655 rows 6 columns. object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 685 rows 6 columns. object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 6 rows 2 columns.

title: COVID 19 Cases in BC for the last year — bccovid
text: data comes British Columbia CDC linelist via {CanCovidData} package.

title: COVID 19 Cases in BC for the last year — bccovid
text: full data (bccovid), contains case count BC. data processed raw file. First, separated Health Authority. "smoothed" applying 7 day trailing sum. mean ,   result cases+0 column. columns "shifts" value. cases+14 response: total number cases observed week ending 14 days date. cases variables features: total number cases week ending date (cases+0), 1 week earlier (cases-7) 2 weeks earlier (cases-14). HA name BC Health Authority. 5 different , UBC located "Vancouver Coastal" along Kitsilano Downtown. SFU, Burnaby, Richmond, Surrey "Fraser". bccovid_train Training set use homework. contains data prior 1 August 2021. bccovid_test Test set use homework. contains 137 rows data (1 August 2021 1 December 2021). bcpop gives number people living BC Health Authority 2020 Census

title: COVID 19 Cases in BC for the last year — bccovid

what: A subset of the NYTimes document corpus — nytimes
title: A subset of the NYTimes document corpus — nytimes
text: datasets contain news stories taken New York Times Annotated Corpus (Sandhaus, 2008), consists 1.8 million stories Times, 1987 2007, hand-annotated actual human beings standardized machine-readable information contents. corpus, Prof. Shalizi randomly selected 57 stories art 45 stories music, turned bag--words data frame, one row per story, one column per word; plus indicator first column whether story art music.

title: A subset of the NYTimes document corpus — nytimes
text: Sandhaus, Evan, 2008, "New York Times Annotated Corpus", https://hdl.handle.net/11272.1/AB2/GZC6PL, Abacus Data Network, V1. Shalizi, Cosma, 2023, "Advanced Data Analysis Elementary Point View", https://www.stat.cmu.edu/~cshalizi/ADAfaEPoV/.

title: A subset of the NYTimes document corpus — nytimes
text: New York Times Annotated Corpus contains 1.8 million articles written published New York Times January 1, 1987 June 19, 2007 article metadata provided New York Times Newsroom, New York Times Indexing Service online production staff nytimes.com. corpus includes: 1.8 million articles (excluding wire services articles appeared covered period). 650,000 article summaries written library scientists. 1,500,000 articles manually tagged library scientists tags drawn normalized indexing vocabulary people, organizations, locations topic descriptors. 275,000 algorithmically-tagged articles hand verified online production staff nytimes.com. Java tools parsing corpus documents .xml memory resident object. part New York Times' indexing procedures, articles manually summarized tagged staff library scientists. collection contains 650,000 article-summary pairs may prove useful development evaluation algorithms automated document summarization. Also, 1.5 million documents least one tag. Articles tagged persons, places, organizations, titles topics using controlled vocabulary applied consistently across articles. instance one article mentions "Bill Clinton" another refers "President William Jefferson Clinton", articles tagged "CLINTON, BILL". New York Times established community website researchers working data set http://groups.google.com/group/nytnlp encourages feedback discussion corpus. nyt_raw contains raw bag--words representation. nyt_tfidf hass format nyt_raw applying TF-IDF weighting.

title: Spotify data for 3 artists — popmusic
text: Audio features recordings Taylor Swift, Radiohead, National, available Spotify API.

title: Spotify data for 3 artists — popmusic
Spotify data for 3 artists — popmusic
text: Audio features one track artist performing music? data contains tracks Taylor Swift, Radiohead, National. acousticness confidence measure 0.0 1.0 whether track acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence track acoustic. danceability Danceability describes suitable track dancing based combination musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, overall regularity. value 0.0 least danceable 1.0 danceable. duration_ms duration track milliseconds. energy Energy measure 0.0 1.0 represents perceptual measure intensity activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, noisy. example, death metal high energy, Bach prelude scores low scale. Perceptual features contributing attribute include dynamic range, perceived loudness, timbre, onset rate, general entropy. instrumentalness Predicts whether track contains vocals. "Ooh" "aah" sounds treated instrumental context. Rap spoken word tracks clearly "vocal". closer instrumentalness value 1.0, greater likelihood track contains vocal content. Values 0.5 intended represent instrumental tracks, confidence higher value approaches 1.0. key key track . Integers map pitches using standard Pitch Class notation. E.g. 0 = C, 1 = C♯/D♭, 2 = D, . key detected, value -1. liveness Detects presence audience recording. Higher liveness values represent increased probability track performed live. value 0.8 provides strong likelihood track live. loudness overall loudness track decibels (dB). Loudness values averaged across entire track useful comparing relative loudness tracks. Loudness quality sound primary psychological correlate physical strength (amplitude). Values typically range -60 0 db. mode Mode indicates modality (major minor) track, type scale melodic content derived. Major represented 1 minor 0. speechiness Speechiness detects presence spoken words track. exclusively speech-like recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), closer 1.0 attribute value. Values 0.66 describe tracks probably made entirely spoken words. Values 0.33 0.66 describe tracks may contain music speech, either sections layered, including cases rap music. Values 0.33 likely represent music non-speech-like tracks. tempo overall estimated tempo track beats per minute (BPM). musical terminology, tempo speed pace given piece derives directly average beat duration. time_signature estimated time signature. time signature (meter) notational convention specify many beats bar (measure). time signature ranges 3 7 indicating time signatures "3/4", "7/4". valence measure 0.0 1.0 describing musical positiveness conveyed track. Tracks high valence sound positive (e.g. happy, cheerful, euphoric), tracks low valence sound negative (e.g. sad, depressed, angry). explicit bad words prevent typical play radio (safe work). object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 1269 rows 15 columns. object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 425 rows 15 columns.

title: Whisky flavour profiles — whisky
text: David Wishart one point, Chief Statistician Scottish Office Civil Service. retired, focused Whisky wrote book called "Whisky Classified". book, collected tasting notes published 86 different Scotch Whisky distilleries number aspects "distilled" 12 flavor categories. distillery's representative whisky given score category 0-4, 0 meaning flavor represented whisky, 4 meaning strongly represented. data set later expanded include distilleries crowd-sourced tasting notes, , data seems kept -profit Windows software longer exists. Dr. Wishart passed away 2020, seems way access larger data set. version data comes first edition Dr. Wishart's book. article describing analyses 185 single malts published 2009 Significance. flavour categories Body, Sweetness, Smoky, Medicinal, Tobacco, Honey, Spicy, Winey, Nutty, Malty, Fruity, Floral. data also contains meta information giving distillery's postcode, Longitude, Latitude.
